member.name: T:SmartCard.Runtime.InteropServices.ISO7816.APDUAttribute
member.summary: The APDUAttribute attribute is attached to methods that are exposed to the external world via the ISO7816 protocol.

remarks.p: You can apply this attribute to methods.
Only the first string argument is mandatory. Mask, StatusWord, and OnInvalidLe are all optional.
Methods that have APDU attributes can still be called using .NET remoting.

member.name: F:SmartCard.Runtime.InteropServices.ISO7816.APDUAttribute.Mask
member.summary: ISO7816 APDU Header Mask.

member.name: F:SmartCard.Runtime.InteropServices.ISO7816.APDUAttribute.StatusWord
member.summary: ISO7816 Status Word to return on nominal execution.
member.remarks: StatusWord is set to 0x9000 by default.

member.name: F:SmartCard.Runtime.InteropServices.ISO7816.APDUAttribute.OnInvalidLe
member.summary: Protocol behavior that should be applied when an invalid Le is presented.
member.remarks: OnInvalidLe is set to APDUInvalidLeAcknowledgeMode.IndicateLa by default.

member.name: F:SmartCard.Runtime.InteropServices.ISO7816.APDUAttribute.AssociatedChannelPortNumber
member.summary: Port number of the communication channel to use.
member.remarks: AssociatedChannelPortNumber is set to -1 by default, meaning use the first registered channel. Valid range: 0 <= AssociatedChannelPortNumber <= 0xFFFF

member.name: M:SmartCard.Runtime.InteropServices.ISO7816.APDUAttribute.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the APDUAttribute class with the specified ISO7816 APDU header (CLA || INS || P1 || P2).

member.name: T:SmartCard.Runtime.InteropServices.ISO7816.APDUExceptionAttribute
member.summary: Indicates how to marshal an exception between managed code and ISO7816 protocol. Allows you to assign a 2-byte ISO7816 status word to an exception that might be thrown by a method.
member.remarks: You can apply this attribute to methods. This attribute is valid only if used in conjunction with APDUAttribute. Matching of exceptions is performed by exact type (mapping ArgumentException will not "catch" an ArgumentNullException).

member.name: F:SmartCard.Runtime.InteropServices.ISO7816.APDUExceptionAttribute.Reason
member.summary: Message associated to the exception.

member.name: M:SmartCard.Runtime.InteropServices.ISO7816.APDUExceptionAttribute.#ctor(System.Type,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the APDUMarshalExceptionAttribute class with the specified exception Type and associated ISO7816 protocol status word.

remarks.p: The exception type must be defined in mscorlib, System.Xml or netCard assemblies, otherwise use the alternate constructor
Setting null as an exceptionType sets the fallback of unprocessed exceptions onto this APDUException attribute.

member.param: ISO7816 equivalent status word as an hexstring

member.name: T:SmartCard.Runtime.InteropServices.ISO7816.APDUHeader
member.summary: Identifies ISO7816 APDU Header parameters.

member.name: F:SmartCard.Runtime.InteropServices.ISO7816.APDUHeader.CLA
member.summary: ISO7816 APDU protocol Class byte.

member.name: F:SmartCard.Runtime.InteropServices.ISO7816.APDUHeader.INS
member.summary: ISO7816 APDU protocol Instruction byte.

member.name: F:SmartCard.Runtime.InteropServices.ISO7816.APDUHeader.P1
member.summary: ISO7816 APDU protocol Parameter1 byte.

member.name: F:SmartCard.Runtime.InteropServices.ISO7816.APDUHeader.P2
member.summary: ISO7816 APDU protocol Parameter2 byte.

member.name: F:SmartCard.Runtime.InteropServices.ISO7816.APDUHeader.P3
member.summary: ISO7816 APDU protocol Parameter3 byte (incoming length:Lc or outgoing length:Le).

member.name: F:SmartCard.Runtime.InteropServices.ISO7816.APDUHeader.P1P2
member.summary: ISO7816 APDU protocol Parameter1 concatenated to Parameter2 bytes.

member.name: T:SmartCard.Runtime.InteropServices.ISO7816.APDUInvalidLeAcknowledgeMode
member.summary: Specifies how the operating system communication stack should react when receiving an outgoing transfer request with an invalid length.

member.name: F:SmartCard.Runtime.InteropServices.ISO7816.APDUInvalidLeAcknowledgeMode.Reject
member.summary: Returns SW=0x6700 on invalid requested length. Le is not accepted by the card which does not support the service of providing data if the length is wrong.

member.name: F:SmartCard.Runtime.InteropServices.ISO7816.APDUInvalidLeAcknowledgeMode.IndicateLa
member.summary: Returns SW=0x6C[La] on invalid requested length. Le is not accepted by the card and the card indicates the available length [La].

member.name: T:SmartCard.Runtime.InteropServices.ISO7816.APDUParamAttribute
member.summary: Indicates how to unmarshal the data between ISO7816 protocol and managed code. You can use this attribute to extract elements of the ISO7816 header into parameters that are passed to the method.
member.remarks: You can apply this attribute to parameters. This attribute is valid only if used in conjunction with an APDUAttribute.
member.example:
usage example: ISO7816 ReadBinary command prototype. APDU received: CLA = 0x00, INS = 0xB0, P1 = XX, P2 = YY, P3 = ZZ
[APDU("00B00000", "0000FFFF")] public void ReadBinary([APDUParam(APDUHeader.P1P2)]int fileOffset, [APDUParam(APDUHeader.P3)] int readLength) { ... The offset encoded in (P1 || P2) bytes of ISO7816 APDU header will be unmarshaled in the "offset" parameter of the method. The expected length P3 will be unmarshaled in "readLength" parameter. ... }

member.name: M:SmartCard.Runtime.InteropServices.ISO7816.APDUParamAttribute.#ctor(SmartCard.Runtime.InteropServices.ISO7816.APDUHeader)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the APDUParamAttribute class with the specified enumeration member.

member.name: T:SmartCard.Services.GCControlAttribute
member.summary: Allow control of the Garbage Collection triggering moment.

member.name: M:SmartCard.Services.GCControlAttribute.#ctor(SmartCard.Services.GCControlMode)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the GCAttribute class.
member.param: specifies when the Garbage Collection should be activated

member.name: T:SmartCard.Services.GCControlMode
member.summary: Specify the Garbage Collection triggering mode

member.name: F:SmartCard.Services.GCControlMode.Force
member.summary: Gargabage Collection will occur during the method invocation.

member.name: F:SmartCard.Services.GCControlMode.Skip
member.summary: Gargabage Collection will not occur during method invocation.

member.name: F:SmartCard.Services.GCControlMode.OnLowMemory
member.summary: Gargabage Collection will occur when system is running out of memory

member.name: T:SmartCard.Services.OutOfTransactionAttribute
member.summary: The OutOfTransaction attribute annotates fields that must not participate whithin possible on-going transactions.
member.remarks: This attribute can only be applied to primitive Types (bool, char, byte, sbyte, short, ushort, int, uint, long, ulong).

member.name: M:SmartCard.Services.OutOfTransactionAttribute.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the OutOfTransactionAttribute class.

member.name: T:SmartCard.Services.TransactionAttribute
member.summary: The Transaction attribute is attached to methods which are contained within their own transactions. A new, nested, transaction is started when a TrnasactionAttribute annotated method is entered, and commited when the method returns. If a method terminates with an uncaught exception the transaction is aborted.

member.name: M:SmartCard.Services.TransactionAttribute.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the TransactionAttribute class.
